tasks.description: Two international students meeting at university. Maria (young woman, Austrian appearance) and Ali (young man, Iranian appearance) standing in modern university hallway with international student posters in background. Both holding textbooks, friendly conversation posture. Diverse student environment visible.
tasks.context: Dialog: International students discussing where they are from - Austria and Iran

specs.style: modern university setting, multicultural atmosphere, bright and welcoming

tasks.notes: Should reflect diversity and international student experience

tasks.description: Educational diagram showing conjugation of verb 'kommen' (to come). Table with four rows: 'ich komme' (I come), 'du kommst' (you come), 'er/sie/es kommt' (he/she/it comes), 'Sie kommen' (you come formal). Add phrase 'kommen aus + country' with small country flags: Germany, Iran, Austria. Color-coded by pronoun.
tasks.context: Grammar tip: Regular verb 'kommen' conjugation and usage with 'aus' for origin

specs.style: educational diagram, clear table format, include visual examples with flags

tasks.notes: Show pattern for regular verbs - important foundation

tasks.description: W-Questions (W-Fragen) educational poster. Display five key question words in large text with icons: WIE (how - speech bubble), WOHER (from where - arrow from point), WO (where - location pin), WER (who - person silhouette), WAS (what - question mark). Include example question for each with small illustration.
tasks.context: Grammar tip: Five essential W-questions in German

specs.style: educational poster, bold typography, memorable icons, color-coded questions

tasks.notes: Make it visually memorable - students need to master these question words

tasks.description: DACH countries map showing Germany, Austria, and Switzerland highlighted in different colors. Each country labeled with flag and name in German: Deutschland, Österreich, die Schweiz. Include capital cities: Berlin, Wien, Bern. Show language distribution in Switzerland with pie chart (German, French, Italian, Romansh). Add population numbers and 'DACH' acronym explanation.
tasks.context: Cultural note: German-speaking countries (DACH region) overview

specs.style: educational map, clear country borders, flags, statistical infographic elements

tasks.notes: Important cultural context for German learners from Iran

tasks.description: Germany (Deutschland): Brandenburg Gate in Berlin with German flag. Iconic landmark photo, clear blue sky, tourist-friendly view. Recognizable symbol of Germany.

specs.style: landmark photography, iconic view, bright daylight

tasks.description: Austria (Österreich): Vienna city center with St. Stephen's Cathedral or Hofburg Palace. Austrian flag visible. Classic Viennese architecture, elegant European atmosphere.

specs.style: architectural photography, historic buildings, Austrian character

tasks.description: Switzerland (die Schweiz): Swiss Alps with traditional Swiss chalet or Matterhorn mountain. Swiss flag visible. Scenic mountain landscape with snow-capped peaks.
tasks.context: Vocabulary: die Schweiz (Switzerland) - country name with article
tasks.notes: Note that Switzerland requires article 'die Schweiz'

tasks.description: Iran: Azadi Tower in Tehran or Naqsh-e Jahan Square in Isfahan. Iranian flag visible. Recognizable Persian architecture, cultural landmark.
tasks.context: Vocabulary: Iran - country name (target audience's home country)

specs.style: landmark photography, Iranian cultural icon, clear sky

tasks.notes: Important for Persian speakers - familiar reference point

tasks.description: University setting. Maria and Ali meet. Dialog: Maria: 'Hallo! Ich bin Maria. Woher kommst du?' - Ali: 'Ich komme aus Iran, aus Teheran. Und du?' - Maria: 'Ich komme aus Österreich. Ich wohne in Wien.' - Ali: 'Wien ist sehr schön!' Natural student interaction, friendly gestures.
tasks.context: Complete dialog demonstrating country origin questions and answers

specs.audio: Clear German pronunciation, natural student conversation pace

tasks.notes: Emphasize 'kommen aus' for origin and 'wohnen in' for current location - key distinction

summary.priority: Focus on W-Fragen poster and DACH map first - core grammar and cultural concepts. Country images help vocabulary retention.
